      • exCreateImageFromNode

        NodeImage exCreateImageFromNode(Node node,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Arg>> block_device_mapping,
                              boolean reboot,
                              java.lang.String description)
        Create an Amazon Machine Image based off of an EBS-backed instance. An example block device mapping dictionary is included: mapping = [{'VirtualName': None, 'Ebs': {'VolumeSize': 10, 'VolumeType': 'standard', 'DeleteOnTermination': 'true'}, 'DeviceName': '/dev/sda1'}]
        Parameters:
        node - Instance of ``Node`` (:type node: :class: `Node`)
        name - The name for the new image (:type name: ``str``)
        block_device_mapping - A dictionary of the disk layout An example of this dict is included below. (:type block_device_mapping: ``list`` of ``dict``)
        reboot - Whether or not to shutdown the instance before creation. By default Amazon sets this to false to ensure a clean image. (:type reboot: ``bool``)
        description - An optional description for the new image (:type description: ``str``)
        Returns:
        Instance of class ``NodeImage`` (:rtype: :class:`NodeImage`)

      • exCreateImageFromNode

        NodeImage exCreateImageFromNode(Node node,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Arg>> block_device_mapping)
        Create an Amazon Machine Image based off of an EBS-backed instance. An example block device mapping dictionary is included: mapping = [{'VirtualName': None, 'Ebs': {'VolumeSize': 10, 'VolumeType': 'standard', 'DeleteOnTermination': 'true'}, 'DeviceName': '/dev/sda1'}]
        Parameters:
        node - Instance of ``Node`` (:type node: :class: `Node`)
        name - The name for the new image (:type name: ``str``)
        block_device_mapping - A dictionary of the disk layout An example of this dict is included below. (:type block_device_mapping: ``list`` of ``dict``)
        Returns:
        Instance of class ``NodeImage`` (:rtype: :class:`NodeImage`)

      • exRegisterImage

        NodeImage exRegisterImage(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String description,
                        java.lang.String architecture,
                        java.lang.String image_location,
                        java.lang.String root_device_name,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Arg> block_device_mapping,
                        java.lang.String kernel_id,
                        java.lang.String ramdisk_id)
        Registers an Amazon Machine Image based off of an EBS-backed instance. Can also be used to create images from snapshots. More information can be found at http://goo.gl/hqZq0a.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for the AMI being registered (:type name: ``str``)
        description - The description of the AMI (optional) (:type description: ``str``)
        architecture - The architecture of the AMI (i386/x86_64) (optional) (:type architecture: ``str``)
        image_location - The location of the AMI within Amazon S3 Required if registering an instance store-backed AMI (:type image_location: ``str``)
        root_device_name - The device name for the root device Required if registering a EBS-backed AMI (:type root_device_name: ``str``)
        block_device_mapping - A dictionary of the disk layout (optional) (:type block_device_mapping: ``dict``)
        kernel_id - Kernel id for AMI (optional) (:type kernel_id: ``str``)
        ramdisk_id - RAM disk for AMI (optional) (:type ramdisk_id: ``str``)
        Returns:
        `NodeImage`

      • exAuthorizeSecurityGroup

        boolean exAuthorizeSecurityGroup(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String from_port,
                               java.lang.String to_port,
                               java.lang.String cidr_ip,
                               java.lang.String protocol)
        Edit a Security Group to allow specific traffic. note: This is a non-standard extension API, and only works for EC2.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the security group to edit (:type name: ``str``)
        from_port - The beginning of the port range to open (:type from_port: ``str``)
        to_port - The end of the port range to open (:type to_port: ``str``)
        cidr_ip - The ip to allow traffic for. (:type cidr_ip: ``str``)
        protocol - tcp/udp/icmp (:type protocol: ``str``)
        Returns:
        ``bool``

      • exAuthorizeSecurityGroup

        boolean exAuthorizeSecurityGroup(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String from_port,
                               java.lang.String to_port,
                               java.lang.String cidr_ip)
        Edit a Security Group to allow specific traffic. note: This is a non-standard extension API, and only works for EC2.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the security group to edit (:type name: ``str``)
        from_port - The beginning of the port range to open (:type from_port: ``str``)
        to_port - The end of the port range to open (:type to_port: ``str``)
        cidr_ip - The ip to allow traffic for. (:type cidr_ip: ``str``)
        Returns:
        ``bool``

      • exAuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress

        boolean exAuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress(java.lang.String id,
                                      int from_port,
                                      int to_port,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> cidr_ips,
                                      java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Arg>> group_pairs,
                                      java.lang.String protocol)
        Edit a Security Group to allow specific ingress traffic using CIDR blocks or either a group ID, group name or user ID (account).
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the security group to edit (:type id: ``str``)
        from_port - The beginning of the port range to open (:type from_port: ``int``)
        to_port - The end of the port range to open (:type to_port: ``int``)
        cidr_ips - The list of ip ranges to allow traffic for. (:type cidr_ips: ``list``)
        group_pairs - Source user/group pairs to allow traffic for. More info can be found at http://goo.gl/stBHJF EC2 Classic Example: To allow access from any system associated with the default group on account 1234567890 [{'group_name': 'default', 'user_id': '1234567890'}] VPC Example: Allow access from any system associated with security group sg-47ad482e on your own account [{'group_id': ' sg-47ad482e'}] (:type group_pairs: ``list`` of ``dict``)
        protocol - tcp/udp/icmp (:type protocol: ``str``)
        Returns:
        ``bool``

      • exFindOrImportKeypairByKeyMaterial

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> exFindOrImportKeypairByKeyMaterial(java.lang.String pubkey)
        Given a public key, look it up in the EC2 KeyPair database. If it exists, return any information we have about it. Otherwise, create it. Keys that are created are named based on their comment and fingerprint.
        Returns:
        ``dict``
